alert.note: Alert for Cameron; Hidalgo; Kenedy; Willacy (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 14 at 10:36PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following counties, Cameron, Hidalgo, Kenedy and Willacy. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1036 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Harlingen, Mercedes, Raymondville, La Feria, Progreso, Edcouch, Santa Rosa, Lyford, La Villa, Lasara, Sebastian, Santa Maria, Lasara Elementary School, Lyford High School, Lyford Elementary School, Lyford City Hall, Raymondville Golf Course, Raymondville Fire Station, Raymondville High School and Reber Memorial Library. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
